**Is your feature request related to a problem? Please describe.**
A clear and concise description of what the problem is. Ex. In my code, I would like to do [...]

Currently `with nogil(condition)` accepts a compile-time condition ([link](https://cython.readthedocs.io/en/latest/src/userguide/fusedtypes.html#conditional-gil-acquiring-releasing)). But how about a runtime condition? Is it possible?
```cython
def increment(double x, is_ok):
    # is_ok is a Python object, x is a C double
    with nogil(is_ok):
        x = x + 1
    return x
```

**Describe the solution you'd like**
A clear and concise description of what you want to happen, including code examples if applicable.

As title. 

**Describe alternatives you've considered**
A clear and concise description of any alternative solutions or features you've considered.

N/A

**Additional context**
Add any other context about the feature request here.

Not sure if that this was not allowed is because of any technical difficulty, or just because no one asked for it, thus I'm raising a discussion. Thanks!
title: [ENH] Allow runtime conditional GIL releasing/acquiring?
